# Issue Templates

This directory contains templates to help you create well-structured GitHub issues.

## Available Templates

### üéÆ Game Scene Request (`game-scene-request.md`)
Use this when you want to request a new scene for either the HTML or ChoiceScript game.

**Best for:**
- Requesting new expedition scenes
- Adding character interaction moments
- Expanding existing story paths
- Creating new endings or branches

### üìö Lore Addition (`lore-addition.md`)
Use this when you want to propose new worldbuilding or lore content.

**Note:** Lore content should ultimately be added via pull requests to markdown files in the `lore/` directory. This template helps you organize your proposal first.

**Best for:**
- Character backstories
- Magic system expansions
- New locations or realms
- Historical events
- Faction details

### üêõ Bug Report (`bug-report.md`)
Use this when something isn't working as expected.

**Best for:**
- Game bugs or errors
- Documentation errors
- Broken links
- Inconsistencies in the game
- Technical problems

### ‚ú® Feature Request (`feature-request.md`)
Use this when you have an idea for a new feature or improvement.

**Best for:**
- New game mechanics
- Automation improvements
- Documentation enhancements
- Repository structure changes
- Development tools

## How to Use Templates

1. Go to the [Issues tab](../../issues)
2. Click "New Issue"
3. Choose the appropriate template
4. Fill in all sections
5. Add relevant labels
6. Submit!

## Guidelines

### Good Issue Checklist
- [ ] Clear, descriptive title
- [ ] Complete template sections
- [ ] Links to related files or issues
- [ ] Appropriate labels applied
- [ ] Context and reasoning provided

### What NOT to Do
- ‚ùå Don't create issues for lore documentation (use PR to `lore/` files)
- ‚ùå Don't create placeholder or test issues
- ‚ùå Don't rely on external links without archiving content
- ‚ùå Don't mix multiple unrelated topics in one issue

## Need Help?

- Read the [Contributing Guide](../../CONTRIBUTING.md)
- Check the [Issue Organization Guide](../../docs/ISSUE_ORGANIZATION_GUIDE.md)
- Use [GitHub Discussions](../../discussions) for conversations
- Ask the custom agent `@my-agent` for lore consistency help

---

*Creating well-structured issues helps everyone contribute more effectively!*
